cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: Agent size normalized
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[function] 
normalize the blob size of agent invariant of its size

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: CARRIED
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
move_to: move together
drop/grasp: pushpull

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: CoS verb
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
+1 index specific concept memories
+3 ordinal index
+3 intention

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: Confirm agent
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: fires when 'original coord targets' are filled

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: Confirm carried
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: fires after tool is bound

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: Confirm location
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: fires after tool is bound

cedar.processing.steps.Convolution.name: Convolution 4
cedar.processing.steps.Convolution.comments: for size changes, agent size might not match transient exactly so enlarge agent size

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: DROP
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: hand size changed then pushed

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: DROP 2
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: hand size changed then pushed

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: DROP 3
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: hand size changed then pushed

cedar.processing.Flip.name: Flip 3
cedar.processing.Flip.comments: - don't flip (or doubleflip) rotational dim, as the 'direction selection' goes clockwise but 'objects' goes counter-clockwise

cedar.processing.Flip.name: Flip 4
cedar.processing.Flip.comments: - don't flip (or doubleflip) rotational dim, as the 'direction selection' goes clockwise but 'objects' goes counter-clockwise

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: GRASP
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: hand size changed then pulled

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: GRASP 2
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: hand size changed then pulled

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: GRASP 3
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: hand size changed then pulled

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: M1
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: Need to be reset after learning phase. One could have another CoS node after O4 to inhibit all memory nodes and learning mode boost, which autonomously starts the replaying sequence

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: Move Together
REFERENCE
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
move_to: near + move toward
drop: near + boost

was using 600 timescale

cedar.dynamics.RateMatrixToSpaceCode.name: Rate Matrix To Space Code 2
cedar.dynamics.RateMatrixToSpaceCode.comments:
use 360 to cover the full color space
0:
1: red
3: yellow
5: green
7: cyan
10: blue (hand)
15:

cedar.processing.Resize.name: Resize 4
cedar.processing.Resize.comments: - nearest interpolation is the most stable w.r.t hue

cedar.processing.StaticGain.name: Static Gain 132
cedar.processing.StaticGain.comments: whenever centered agent signal kicks in, that is not size change

cedar.processing.StaticGain.name: Static Gain 165
cedar.processing.StaticGain.comments: shouldn't be too big, as this means near match will be inhibited by a large amount,taking longer to get activated when going from mid to near distance

cedar.processing.StaticGain.name: Static Gain 3
cedar.processing.StaticGain.comments: inhibit same object playing different roles just to be sure

cedar.processing.StaticGain.name: Static Gain 86
cedar.processing.StaticGain.comments: inhibit same object playing different roles just to be sure

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: TRANSPORT
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: when hand movement is detected

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: TRANSPORT 2
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: when hand movement is detected

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: TRANSPORT 3
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: when hand movement is detected

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: agent gate
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: gating, sequential binding

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: agent moved
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]

1 transient
1 agent
sum 2

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: agent removed transient
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
same problem with agent removed perception
now using fixed color to remove agent slice

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: agent-centered objects
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[function]
represent every objects centered on the current agent candidate except for the candidate itself

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: agent-centered trans
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: slightly high self-exci to sustain peaks longer

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: boost drop
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: drop is the verb + after carried is registered

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: centered agent
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[function]
center the agent object while keeping its size intact

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: color selection
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: - extract the color (identfying feature of object) of the selected object

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: cond NONE
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
timer based

[input]
clean after a phrase
timer
inhibit timer

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: delay inhibit memory
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: memory shouldn't be deleted immediately so that cleaning node can be on for sufficient time

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: double inhibition
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: primitives can be found only when there is prior intention to do so (don't use intention as this inhibits primitives after memory node fires)

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: fix reference to NONE
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: if primitive is confirmed as grasping, no reference object..

cedar.processing.StaticGain.name: gain 1
cedar.processing.StaticGain.comments: should happen only after finding carrried...

cedar.processing.StaticGain.name: inhi from fast
cedar.processing.StaticGain.comments:
whenever an object stops or start moving, shouldn't be considered as pushpull

this also should be at grounded lvl ?

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: limited WM size change
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
size change happend recently, otherwise no push/pull

[input]
+6 size change
-10 timer
-10 termination

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: move toward
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: derotated (reverse rotation w.r.t. movement direction) but still centered arount the tool candidate

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: near filter
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
not fields, static filters
size:17-31

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: normalized transient
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[function]
normalize to 1, get rid of spourious transients that aren't well supported by nearby peaks

[regime] 
multi-peak tracking detection

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: orig size object of interest
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
centered transient is instable and sometimes moves itself in other direction (e.g. mid dist to close dist, when it's moving further away)
We therefore use the transient to select the object of interest but use the input from perception to get the object location itself

also transient onset and offset is different depending on direction

a bit slower so that others field have enough time to form inhibition peaks

[input] 
obj ac
inhi from others

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: others
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: negative inputs from enlarged ac transients

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: precondition 3
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: leave enough time for color selection to be free again

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: pushed no side effect
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: make sure that transients are not due to transient starting/fading

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: pushed/pulled obj
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
match fields
push/pull signal

form a peak only if object is pushed/pulled

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: ref NONE
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: fix to NONE if grasp

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: reference WM
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
boosting detection fields directly won't work as additional objects might enter the field

e.g. for reference move_to, just an object near would enter

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: reset timer
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
size change should happen in close proximity...
timer is reset when current action is terminated

[input]
+6 limted size change
-10 termination
~ -10 size change

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: reset timer 3
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
+6 limited move toward
-10 move toward (as long as move toward is on, timer shouldn't start)

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: reset timer 4
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
+6 limited move toward
-10 move toward (as long as move toward is on, timer shouldn't start)

cedar.processing.Resize.name: rotation in pol
cedar.processing.Resize.comments: when size are different, convolution results in weird stuff

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: size change grasp/drop
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
4 grasp/drop
2normalized size change

[regime]
 sustained if grasp/drop is on

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: size changed then pull
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
+4 grasp
+1 a not b
+1 b

[regime]
sustained as long as grasp is on

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: size changed then push
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
+4 grasp
+1 a not b
+1 b

[regime]
sustained as long as grasp is on

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: spatial selection
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
serves as a unifying field of all roles to feed slice input to 3d selection field
carried/reference need reverse coord transform

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: stabilized direction
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
27: upward
0 : rightward
8: downward
20:leftward

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: terminate drop
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
+4 grasp
+1 size changed then pulled
+1 pulled object no movement

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: terminate grasp
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
+4 grasp
+1 size changed then pulled
+1 pulled object no movement

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: terminate move_to
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
+4 verb move_to
+1 tool moved
+1 no tool movement
+1 ref obj found

tool moved then (there is no movement and there exists a reference object)

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: termination active transient
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: make sure that location representations of objects are sustained until current action sentence is parsed sucessfully

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: tool moved
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
they do not have to be WM, can also decay slow enough so that b node is on before decay

[input]
+1.5 move_to
+4 agent moved

[regime]
sustained as long as move_to is on

slower than no movement to allow it enough time to die out

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: tool space-direction perception
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
only use transients of tool to avoid falsely overlapping transients from other objects
(e.g. when grasp, away signal from hand might overlap with toward signal from pulled object)

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: toward cos
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: fire at location of objects toward which the current tool candidate is moving

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: verb transport
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments:
[input]
+3 ordinal index
+3 intention
+1 actual  concept node
+1.5 termination signal

ui.text: Input pre-processing
normalize output cone size
Transientdetector

does it make sense that we can register transients at different location at the same time? Shouldn't this also go thru attentional bottleneck? Then also the problem shifted muiltiplication with different size/shape becomes easier to solve

transients are considered low-level thing
Move toward

Direction
perception
after providing information about initial guess, it is used to track whether the object keeps moving in that direction
could make it simpler by defining synaptic map on polar coord, but harder to interpret
currently, always the hand but at the end need to account for tool use based on contact information
Primitives

should delete AGENT istead of hand
needed to get all objects except the AGENT itself
alternatively, delete after convolution, but often not clean due to objects being near or even worse, contacting

only when there's significant overlap between slow and fast  centered field (= object stays in same place)

using conventional transient detector on the other hand (using difference) doesn't work due to instable repr of object moving together (register that object is moving in centered frame when it isn't)
role fields
Termination
extract colors

MOVE_TO: AGENT / LOCATION / (CARRIED)
agent: hand
location: near + toward
carried: near + together
termination: object near agent + agent stopped moving

DROP_OFF: AGENT / LOCATON / CARRIED
agent: hand
location: from previous move_to
carried: from previous move_to
termination: hand doesn't open anymore (simply done by boost node)

Move 
together
Concept copies
if pick up is the primitive, we already know that refernce slot isn't used (argument realisation based on semantics of verb)
Modules
future modifications
explanations
ToDo now
Near
Size change detection

gating roles for different primitives are not trivial

leads to combinatorial explosion

intersting parallel to the hypothesis in linguistics that there are no fixed lists of roles..

based on the fact that there is no universal characterstic shared across all primitives for each role... (or there is but our relational operators don't map onto that)
pulled/pushed

prim_hypo_test
requires revisiting primitives to change if necessary..

[order of magnitude]
movement < size change < push/pull

[sequence of hypo change]
e.g. for grasping
1. hand starts becoming bigger, but only movement is detected and no size changed detected yet -> move_to
2. size change detected -> grasp or drop by luck (and kept even after the signal is gone)
3. pulled object detected ->
grasp
one can imagine whenever the reverse order occurs (b before a), this inihibits the current hypo

1. Use centered transient input to match fields
need to use movement on/off transient detectors to inhibit pushed/pulled when it is in fact just movement stopping/starting
centered transients aren't reliable and results in oscilation between match fields

2. use perception with movement confirmation
move/dist match ensures that pushed/pulled are registered only when matched object is also moving

3. memory of size change ensures that not random movements are regiestered as push/pull

It's not correct to check different stages from the start when primitive changes as some inital stages might already been surpassed
works now only because primitives change relatively early and all stages can be checked
it also doesn't make sense that we can check different stages for all primitives at the same time
need to check for only later stages and omitting initial stages as necessary
share conditions with grasp
should hypothess be represented as subthreshold peak at time point of size change?
Conceptually, double inhibition should come from intention and not prior
check that object changing the distance is the same object that is registered beforehand, otherwise unwanted side effect from erroneous transients
problem with multiple objects... spuorious effects..
CoS is done by taking 'current' index nodes into account, not all of them
note that gating fields might be needed theoretically
if WM isn't tracking, continuuous sequence might e possible?
now remove instead of clean cuz memory stays within the same sequence

Ordinal
memory
CoS is now CoS of all subprocesses
